page.title: 04MAY DAY AND THE MAYPOLE/2
page.content:
This story was found to be impossible as Raven's map of Holywood points out. It dates from about 1625 and shows a Maypole structure in the exact spot where those sailors are said to have erected their mast in the 1700's. A much more likely story says that Early English settlers in Holywood much used to Maypole traditions in their homeland, quickly made a Maypole in their new homeland and it has for centuries been an important feature of life in Holywood. Many people come to Holywood to see this genuine attraction today.
May Day just would not be the same without the Maypole. It catches everyone's eye, as dancing routines are performed around it. On special occasions like May Day the Maypole is decorated with ribbons and flowers.
